content.question: ​A ball is dropped from a height of <math alttext="10"><semantics><mn>10</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> feet. The ball repeatedly bounces, and the maximum height of the ball after each bounce is <math alttext="20 percent sign"><semantics><mrow><mn>20</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> less than the previous maximum height. Which of the following arguments is correct regarding a sequence that can be used to model the successive maximum heights, in feet?

choices.label: ​An arithmetic sequence is appropriate because each successive height would be found by subtracting <math alttext="2"><semantics><mn>2</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> from the previous height.

​An arithmetic sequence is appropriate because each successive height would be found by multiplying the previous height by <math alttext="0.8"><semantics><mn>0.8</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​​A geometric sequence is appropriate because each successive height would be found by subtracting <math alttext="2"><semantics><mn>2</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> from the previous height.

​​A geometric sequence is appropriate because each successive height would be found by multiplying the previous height by <math alttext="0.8"><semantics><mn>0.8</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

content.answer: ​​A geometric sequence is appropriate because each successive height would be found by multiplying the previous height by <math alttext="0.8"><semantics><mn>0.8</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.
